references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it directly addresses contract scheduling, a problem closely related to the one-way trading problem discussed in the main paper, and introduces the concept of brittleness in Pareto-optimal algorithms.

references.paper_title: Competitive caching with machine learned advice
references.reason: This is a seminal work in the field of learning-augmented online algorithms and provides a foundational framework for analyzing the performance of algorithms that leverage imperfect predictions.

references.paper_title: Improving online algorithms via ML predictions
references.reason: This paper is foundational in exploring how machine learning predictions can enhance the performance of online algorithms and introduces key concepts relevant to the tradeoffs explored in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Optimal search and one-way trading online algorithms
references.reason: This work presents a foundational analysis of the one-way trading problem, which is central to the main paper, establishing optimal competitive ratios in a setting without prediction.

references.paper_title: Pareto-optimal learning-augmented algorithms for online conversion problems
references.reason: This paper introduces a Pareto-optimal algorithm for online conversion problems and is directly relevant to the main paper because it explores the tradeoff between consistency and robustness in the presence of predictions, similar to the main paper’s focus.
